definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang
harbor district/Haigang district of Qinhuangdao city 秦皇島市|秦皇岛市[Qin2 huang2 dao3 shi4], Hebei

sentences.english: In the harbor sailboats are easily cruising on the blue and peaceful water.
sentences.chinese: 海港中，帆船在湛蓝而平静的海面上飘来飘去。

sentences.english: This harbour teemed with oceangoing commerce.
sentences.chinese: 这一海港曾经有繁盛的海外贸易。

sentences.english: In nearby Dana Point, they are prohibited from casting a fishing line in the harbor.
sentences.chinese: 在附近的戴纳波恩特市，他们被禁止在海港钓鱼。

sentences.english: Left, the seaport of Kavala on the Aegean.
sentences.chinese: 图为爱琴海中的海港卡瓦拉。

sentences.english: Unlike Ivory Coast and Gambia, Mali has no seaports.
sentences.chinese: 与象牙海岸和冈比亚不同，马里没有海港。

sentences.english: This bus line goes to the harbor.
Seldom had I seen such a beautiful sea-port.
sentences.chinese: 这样美丽的海港，我几乎从未见过。
1932年的今天，悉尼海港大桥开通。

sentences.english: Hats turned into bathroom medias and the scarves into direct mails .
sentences.chinese: 净化海港计划变成了浴室，媒体和围巾，直接邮件。

sentences.english: It It's a little bay with Hot Bay's harbours , mountains and magnificent beach views.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个有著海港，高山，和绮丽的海滩景象的小港。

sentences.english: People swim in the harbor and go to rest on the buoys.
sentences.chinese: 人们在海港游泳，在游泳圈上休息。

sentences.english: The tugboat tugged the freighter into the harbor.
sentences.chinese: 拖轮把货船拖进海港了。

sentences.english: Yes, Shanghai is an ice-free port.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，上海港是一个不冻港。

sentences.english: The products of inland provinces and municipalities can get access to the international market through the coastal port cities.
sentences.chinese: 内地省市的产品可以通过沿海港口城市打向国际市场。

sentences.english: Founded c. 1200, the city is a port and shipbuilding center. Population, 86,873.
sentences.chinese: 建于公元1200年，该城市是一个海港和造船中心。
